alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 12:03PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Elkhead Creek, including Moffat and Routt Counties in northwest Colorado. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas remains possible. Water may rise over county roadways overnight, which is when the Elkhead typically sees a peak in diurnal crests. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1202 PM MDT, gage data and forecast hydrographs continue to show Elkhead oscillating above bankfull each night, but remain below flood stage, through the weekend. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Moffat and West Central Routt Counties - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
